intro: Gesneria pulchella, commonly known as the pink gesneria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, featuring glossy, dark green leaves with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and requires well-drained, moist soil. Gesneria pulchella is popular among collectors for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
